function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Comparing activity levels during lockdown to baseline may not account for the impact of abnormal weather variations on recreational activity.","Impact":"Potential confounding effect on the accuracy of assessing the impact of lockdown on recreational activity.","Mitigation":"Incorporate weather variations as a factor in the assessment of recreational activity during lockdown.","Technologies":"Statistical modeling that includes weather variables and their lagged effects.","People":"Researchers, public health officials, policymakers","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Deviation in recreational activity levels during lockdown may not align with predicted levels based on weather conditions, leading to inaccurate assessments.","Impact":"Inaccurate assessment of the impact of lockdown on recreational activity and its relation to weather conditions.","Mitigation":"Use 95% prediction confidence intervals as benchmarks to assess the significance of observed deviations in recreational activity.","Technologies":"Statistical modeling, prediction modeling, confidence interval analysis.","People":"Researchers, public health officials, policymakers","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Lack of consideration for spatial covariates and their impact on recreational activity assessment during lockdown.","Impact":"Incomplete understanding of the spatial factors influencing recreational activity levels during lockdown.","Mitigation":"Incorporate spatial covariates such as population density, land use, and accessibility into the assessment of recreational activity during lockdown.","Technologies":"Geospatial analysis, GIS mapping, spatial data modeling.","People":"Researchers, urban planners, public health officials","Owner":"Research institutions, urban planning departments"}]}
